title: Jacob Alon Wins a Big Music Award
summary: Jacob Alon is a singer from Scotland who just won a special music award called the Brits Critics' Choice Award. This award is for new and talented musicians. Jacob was very surprised and happy to win. They beat other singers like Sienna Spiro and Rose Gray. Jacob makes folk music and wrote an album about love stories. They started playing music in school talent shows but first studied science at university. Later, Jacob moved to London to try music but found success back in Scotland. Jacob uses they/them pronouns and thanked everyone for supporting their work.

background_read: The Brits Critics' Choice Award is a prize in the UK music industry given to promising new artists. It helps them become more famous. Past winners include big stars like Adele. Jacob Alon is a non-binary musician, which means they do not identify as only male or female, and they use they/them pronouns. This award shows that hard work in music can lead to success, even if someone starts in a different field like science.
